name: Hotel Playa Costa Verde

reviews.title: Loved Cuba
reviews.text: This was my first time to Cuba and was a great experience. I read the reviews on the Trip Advisor before deciding on a resort and most were 100% accurate. This is my first time writing a review, so hopefully I will cover everything:

reviews.title: What a Place
reviews.text: There were 4 people travelling between the ages of 38 - 68.

There were 2 planes arriving at the Holguin airport so it was a bit congested. The airport is very small but it only took about 45 minutes from the time we landed to the time we were seated in the bus ready to go to the resort. There is only 1 conveyor belt for luggage so one of the airport workers will take the luggage off the belt - you may have to look a bit for your luggage. The drive to the resort was nice in a coach bus with air conditioning - you got to do some sightseeing.
reviews.title: Great Vacation
WOW
reviews.text: The check in at the resort went quite quickly. You don't have to carry your luggage to your room - they will use one of the golf carts to do this. We stayed in the 2200 block of rooms on the second storey. We had no problems with bugs or noise. There was a minor problem with the air conditioner and safe, but they were fixed quickly. You may want to ask for an extra room key as the electricity in the room is controlled by your room key. Our maid left towel creations every morning along with bottles of water. Our room was very close to the restaurants, entertainment area, lobby and pool. It was about a 5 - 10 minute walk to the beach area.

reviews.title: Third is as good as the first
reviews.text: I was a bit leary about the food as I am a very picky eater. I have to say, there is just such a huge assortment of food that I never went hungry. We all thought the food was great. Make your reservations for the a la carte restaurants (done in the lobby area) as soon as you get there as they fill up quickly. The line up for reservations is shorter in the afternoons. The Bariay is the buffet restaurant. You must try the freshly squeezed orange juice - it is excellent!! We ate here in the mornings and a couple of nights. We ate at the Cuban, Italian and Japanse Restaurants and again the food was good. The snack bar "Los Caneyes" is where we ate lunches most days. They serve pizza, hamburgs, hotdogs and french fries. The only thing I will mention about the restaurants is that sometimes the English translation of the food is not really what the dish is. For example, their chicken ceasar salad is really some type of fish on a bed of rice. The ice cream bar is fantastic. Make sure you try every flavour of ice cream.

Like the previous reviews, we just got back from a WONDERFUL week at Playa Costa Verde on March 10th. Four of us (early 50's) spent an amazing week there. As the previous comment pointed out - you can definitely find more luxurious resorts and if that is what you are looking for, you have to pay the price.
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation in Playa Costa Verde

reviews.text: We have travelled to quite a few places including: Mayan Riviera (3 times), Cozumel, Mazatlan, Puerto Vallarta, Manzanillo and Cayo Coco and for the money we spent, PCV is every bit as nice as any others we were at. Keep in mind that when you are deciding on a vacation spot, most of us look for 'the best bang for our buck'. Please remember this when you are judging and comparing resorts (5 star resorts on the Mayan are different than 5 stars in Cuba).
reviews.title: 3rd trip in 4 yrs to PCV - as objective as it gets

reviews.text: The previous review was very thorough and accurate, so I will try not to be repetitive.
reviews.title: GLBT @ Costa Verde
Great Resort With Great People
reviews.text: One thing I will caution is when you arrive in the Holguin airport - PLEASE watch your bags. If you stand at one spot and expect them all to come on the conveyor to you, don't. There are people (airport workers) taking them off randomly and when you go to find them, they offer to take them to your bus - no doubt hoping for a tip. Have a tag identifying your resort on all your luggage and make sure all your bags get on your bus and when you get to your resort, make sure you have all of them before the bus leaves -one of our carry-ons didn't get unloaded and we never did get it back.

reviews.title: Great Resort for Cuban Standards
reviews.text: Another thing to keep in mind is how many bags you bring - we brought 2 bags each, not counting our carry-ons, and were questioned and asked to open the bags because they thought this was too many for 2 people. We actually had one bag full of towels, sheets, sundry items, clothes and toys to give away and were asked to pay 20 CUC at the airport for bringing in this many. I don't know if this is indeed a policy or if someone saw a way to make a few extra pesos, as we did not encounter this when we came before and we had the same number of bags then. We just paid it and were on our way.

reviews.title: Playa Costa Verde
reviews.text: Just returned from Playa Costa Verde, and all I can say is, "fantastic". From the moment we arrived until leaving 2 weeks later, the service, friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, (including our Thomas Cook rep) was superb. The Japanese restaurant was second to none, (we managed 4 trips there!!). We met some lovely people there, mainly Canadians and both my husband and I would not hesitate to go back.

reviews.title: Great place for families!
reviews.text: We just returned from Playa Costa Verde in Holguin, Cuba, which we booked through Sunquest Vacations. We were there from March 1st-8th , 2006. I was there with my husband and 2 ½ year old son. We are in our mid-thirties. It was a great place and I would recommend it to other families and couples. I would probably not recommend Skyservice if you can avoid it. Meals are a joke, there’s not a lot of leg room, headphones cost money, etc. From previous vacations I would have to recommend Air Canada Vacations over some of the other vacation suppliers due to their quick check-in, advanced seating (free), good in-flight meals and regular size airplanes.

reviews.title: Amazing Trip!
reviews.text: First of all, let me start by saying that my husband and I are avid travelers. We’ve traveled to Europe, Malaysia, Mexico (multiple locations—Cancun, Acapulco, Pto. Vallarta, Manzanillo, Mayan Riviera, etc.), Bali, Singapore, Jamaica (Jack Tar Village and Sandals), Cuba (Cayo Coco, Varadero), Florida, Bahamas, and Dominican Republic, to name a few.
I decided to write this review after the reviews I read helped us make a decision to go here. Thanks for all the reviews and the people that replied to my emails.
reviews.title: Loved Everything !
It was much more than what we expected!
reviews.text: At the Holguin airport, we opted to use a porter since we had the toddler, a stroller, 2 carry-ons and 3 bags. We tipped him a couple of bucks American. The bus was fine, air conditioned and our Sunquest rep actually did her entire talk on the way to the hotel so we didn’t have to meet her the next day for all the info. The bus ride was probably about an hour, but this went by quickly as we listened to the rep. They do not serve drinks on the bus, so buy them at the airport, either inside or from the guy that has a little desk by the buses. You can use American, but they do charge you more. My husband bought a couple of beers for $5.00 US.

We just spent March Break at PCV and were not disappointed. Yes, the Holguin airport is a nightmare coming and going, but once you get to PCV and settle in, the resort is very comfortable and family-friendly. A few points to reinforce the reviews we read (and we read just about all of them):
reviews.title: Excellent Family Vacation

reviews.text: 1. Book the a la carte restaurants as soon as you get to the resort (get in line right beside front desk from about 9am to 5pm). The line ups will be very long once everyone gets their orientation and figures out what to do. Italian, Creole and Japanese restaurants were all excellent, with top-notch service. Dont bother booking the new Caribbean a la carte beside the pool - you are only allowed 3 a la carte bookings/week and you can go there for lunch without booking.
reviews.title: PCV Was Awesome!
Excellent BEACH
reviews.text: 2. Buffet restaurant is fine (not gourmet - but it's Cuba!). Recommend you sit in the same section every meal, and tip a little every day. Your servers will really appreciate it and give you great service. Omar is excellent!! Sit in the section closest to the front desk and tell him you read about him on the Internet!!

reviews.title: Fabulous Trip at Playa Costa Verde
reviews.text: 3. Rooms are quite large and clean. A few critters, but nothing to scream about. Lots of water pressure. Beds are a bit low to the ground. Tip your chambermaid the first day - she will appreciate it and likely refill your fridge daily.

reviews.title: Our Stay At Playa Costa Verde
reviews.text: 4. Beach is excellent - beautiful clear water, fine beige sand, snorkelling right from shore, plenty of shade and beach chairs. If you whine about the 2 minute walk throught the wetland area to get to the beach, you should probably join a gym and not book an all-inclusive vacation to Cuba!

description: Accommodation, buffet meals, 4 a la carte restaurants, 6 bars, 24-hour snacks and Lobby, unlimited drinks, Mini Club, pools, Jacuzzis, day/night entertainment, water/land sports with equipment and instruction, gym, meeting facilities, air-conditioned rooms with bathroom, hair drier, telephone, safe, satellite TV, CD player, iron and ironing board, tea/coffee maker, mini fridge with welcome drinks, terrace or balcony. All Inclusive! Plus ($): Internet, tours, hairdresser, and shop.
